title: Advanced English 502
headline: This free online English course explains how to use conjunctions and provides useful vocabulary used to describe people.
description: This English course teaches students words and phrases related to different types of people and what irritates them. Our grammar section focuses on conjunctions and explains how to use coordinating, subordinating, and paired conjunctions. We then show you how inverting negative adverbs can improve a sentence. We recommend this course for those who want to improve their English skills while they enrich their conversational vocabulary.
courseDescription:
This English course helps students learn the grammar essentials they need to master this global language and provides useful vocabulary they can use in English conversations. The first part of the course expands your vocabulary by introducing you to a wide range of personality types and their corresponding feelings about life's irritations, also known as 'pet peeves.' We provide articles, videos, and audio clips to help you improve your English proficiency.

The course's first grammar unit explains the seven distinct forms of coordinating conjunctions and the six different subordinating conjunctions. Our second grammar lesson covers topics such as paired conjunctions and using negative adverbs in conjunction with paired conjunctions to create sentence inversion. Conjunctions play an important role in English, so these lessons will boost your confidence and ability to use the language.

We have designed the course's final section to help you master your English skills in all three areas: reading, speaking, and writing. We draw on your newfound vocabulary about personality types to demonstrate the grammar rules governing the use of conjunctions. You can practice your skills by completing the exercises in our 'Resources' section, which also serves as a helpful guide and reference point. Confidence in English can open personal and professional doors for you, so sign up for these English lessons to improve your grammar and expand your vocabulary.
